meanings.sent1: The pond was full of ducks swimming gracefully.
meanings.sent2: I saw a family of ducks waddling by the lake.
meanings.sent3: The ducks quacked happily as they splashed in the water.
meanings.sent4: The ducks in the sky formed a perfect V shape as they migrated south.
meanings.sent5: The little girl fed the ducks at the park, giggling with delight.

meanings.definition: To lower the head or body quickly to avoid something.
meanings.sent1: The boy ducks under the tree branch to avoid hitting his head.
meanings.sent2: She ducks instinctively as the ball comes flying towards her.
meanings.sent3: The cat ducks playfully as the toy mouse swings towards it.
meanings.sent4: He ducks his head to avoid the low doorway in the old house.
meanings.sent5: The dancer ducks gracefully to avoid colliding with her partner.

meanings.sent1: The student ducks out of the classroom to avoid the teacher's scolding.
meanings.sent2: She ducks the question skillfully, not wanting to reveal her secret.
meanings.sent3: The fox ducks behind the bushes to escape the chasing hounds.
meanings.sent4: He ducks the responsibility, leaving others to clean up the mess.
meanings.sent5: The thief ducks into an alley to avoid being caught by the police.
